match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: Zimbabwe won by 6 wickets (with 14 balls remaining)

image.caption: The Galle Fort is in view as Shane Warne bowls
image.longCaption: The Galle Fort is in view as Shane Warne bowls, Sri Lanka vs Australia, 1st Test, Galle, 2nd day, March 9, 2004

match.hoursInfo: 09.45 start, First Session 09.45-13.15, Interval 13.15-14.00, Second Session 14.00-17.30

otherSerieses.name: SL v ZIM ODIs
otherSerieses.longName: Zimbabwe in Sri Lanka ODI Series

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c & b Cremer 86 (80b 8x4 1x6 112m) SR: 107.5

dismissalComment.html: deceived him in flight and then takes an excellent return catch. Mendis looks to work this across the line but can only manage a leading edge. Cremer ran to his right, put his hand out to nonchalantly pluck the catch. A century was there for the taking.

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga not out 79 (73b 8x4 1x6 107m) SR: 108.21

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: throws his wicket away. The off-side field was packed and Chatara bowls to his field by pitching it up outside off, Dickwella clears the front leg and carves a drive. Fails to keep it down and sends it into the hands of Ryan Burl at covers

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: short of good length ball, Gunaratne again has to contend with a serious lack of pace. Besides, he has to fetch it from outside off so had to entirely rely on his power. Finds the top edge that is held at deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka c Ervine b Williams 60 (77b 5x4 1x6 110m) SR: 77.92

dismissalComment.html: brain freeze! Especially because he got a boundary off the previous delivery. Looks to play a reverse sweep this time, Williams spots that and fires this across, he goes through with the shot but can't get any timing or power on the stroke and finds backward point.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews b Mire 43 (30b 6x4 1x6 45m) SR: 143.33

dismissalComment.html: cleaned him up. Just back of a length and Mathews instinctively responds with a pull shot. There is no pace on the ball as Mire rolled his fingers over it. Besides, there is not much room outside off and he gets tucked up, ends up missing the shot as the ball crashes into the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Asela Gunaratne c Waller b Chatara 28 (26b 4x4 0x6 33m) SR: 107.69

dismissalComment.html: short of good length ball, Gunaratne again has to contend with a serious lack of pace. Besides, he has to fetch it from outside off so had to entirely rely on his power. Finds the top edge that is held at deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c & b Gunaratne 112 (96b 14x4 0x6 164m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear! Soft dismissal. Gunaratne's chance of pace does it. Back of a length delivery, Mire is hanging back and pushes it back to the bowler, can't keep it down as he does not read the drop in pace too well. Gunaratne takes it without fuss. What a good innings this has been. He has given Zimbabwe a real chance here.Up to Williams and the rest now

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza not out 67 (56b 7x4 1x6 57m) SR: 119.64

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear! Soft dismissal. Gunaratne's chance of pace does it. Back of a length delivery, Mire is hanging back and pushes it back to the bowler, can't keep it down as he does not read the drop in pace too well. Gunaratne takes it without fuss. What a good innings this has been. He has given Zimbabwe a real chance here.Up to Williams and the rest now

oh, dear. Williams, what have you done? Plays all around a full delivery. Looked to nurdle this to the leg side but was better off looking to ease it down the ground. This was full, cramped him for room and deflected off the boot onto the stumps. Back to back wickets for Asela. Sri Lanka are up and running

dreadful shot to a loose delivery that should've been whacked for four. Masakadza was way too early into the pull as he gloved this down leg side to the keeper. Oh, hang on. The umpire's are having a look. This could be a no-ball. Looks like there was just about a millimetre behind the crease at the point of impact. Very, very close.

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c †Dickwella b Malinga 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: dreadful shot to a loose delivery that should've been whacked for four. Masakadza was way too early into the pull as he gloved this down leg side to the keeper. Oh, hang on. The umpire's are having a look. This could be a no-ball. Looks like there was just about a millimetre behind the crease at the point of impact. Very, very close.

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Tharanga b Dananjaya 18 (23b 2x4 0x6 37m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: this was just a matter of time. Both batsmen were completely in a tangle against spin. Ervine looks to sweep this and gets across a long way to play the shot, had to hit it against the stiff breeze. Didn't get any power behind the shot as it lobbed straight to the man stationed at deep backward square leg.

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Gunaratne 65 (69b 7x4 0x6 116m) SR: 94.2

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear. Williams, what have you done? Plays all around a full delivery. Looked to nurdle this to the leg side but was better off looking to ease it down the ground. This was full, cramped him for room and deflected off the boot onto the stumps. Back to back wickets for Asela. Sri Lanka are up and running

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: they hadn't hit a six up until this point in the chase. Now, he sees the ball tossed up over the eyeline, gets to the pitch of the ball and hammers it down the ground, beats long-on comfortably. Wow, what a way to finish. This has been a stunning chase. Handshakes, hugs all around in the Zimbabwe dressing room. They've sauntered home

commentPostTextItems.html: 5.45pm If bowing out early, in heartbreaking fashion, from the Champions Trophy wasn't enough, Sri Lanka have endured another crushing blow. This is the highest successful chase ever in Sri Lanka, in 296 ODIs. How's that for a record? The heroes? Solomon Mire, who set the pace. Sean Williams who carried on to bring the chase within a 100 runs, and Sikandar Raza for ensuring the good work done by those two didn't go to waste. How easy have they made it look? Worrying signs for Sri Lanka. The bowling was toothless. The fielding? Well, it wasn't any better. This is also the first time Zimbabwe have beaten Sri Lanka in Sri Lanka. Surely it merits a big party tonight!

There's plenty of post-match coverage. Andrew Fernando's bulletin will be up shortly, for those who want to relive a special chase. Hope you join us for the second ODI on Sunday. Until then, this is Shashank Kishore saying goodbye on behalf of Akshay Gopalakrishnan. Cheers!

Dinesh: "Zimbabwe had that reputation of being the giant killers in the early 2000s and now, well and truly, they are back on big stage. Chasing 300 in Sri Lanka against Sri Lanka is incredible effort. Take a bow" Can't let one big effort mask all that's happened in between. As Cremer said, one step at a time.
Solomon Mire is the Player of the match.

Graeme Cremer: Very special! To chase down a score like that to post our first win here was amazing. For our batting to chase the total down, special. Mire is a real asset to the team, not just with the bat but also with the ball. He's lovely to watch. We just want to take it one game at a time. We can hopefully carry this confidence forward.

Angelo Mathews: Having 315 on the board, I thought it was enough. Our bowling was poor and our fielding was pathetic. It was a good batting effort by them. The wicket was playing a little slower. I thought we had the bowling to defend this.

Sikandar Raza: The selectors and coaches have shown consistency. A lot of cricket behind us has helped us pull off this fantastic win. I kept saying myself that this had to be for Solomon. For someone to play in this kind of heat after bowling his heart out, that was sensational. I wanted to do it for him.
Sean Williams: Solomon and I spoke about taking ones and twos, and batting till the 40th over. We wanted to play the sweeps and reverse-sweeps to keep the runs ticking.

commentTextItems.html: tossed up outside off, he makes room and drives this inside-out to deep cover
drifting into middle and leg, nurdled to deep square leg as they jog the single
fired into middle and leg, he walks across the stumps and paddles this into the deep fine leg region
too full on middle and leg, tickled to short fine leg

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: beaten outside off. Played down the wrong line, this one skid across.
was through with the flick, the ball dipped on him and spun away to hit him on the back pad. Deflects to short third man
rocks back and cuts this to deep point, a misfield from Asela allows them to come back for the second
tossed up on middle and leg from around the stumps, whipped to deep midwicket
he's smeared this reverse sweep into the deep point boundary. The fielder was no more than a couple of metres away. Strong wrists. This wasn't all that full but he picked it superbly
backs away to squeeze the low full toss into the gap at deep point

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: hustled for pace, got into a tangle as he tried to evade the bouncer, lobbed to square leg
too full outside off, squeezed behind point to the boundary rider
right behind the line in defence
excellent bouncer, angled into the body, he looks to arch back and help it over the keeper's head but misses.
incoming length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to deep square leg
fizzes through off the deck, eased back to the bowler.

headshotImage.caption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nuwan Pradeep player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Avadhesh: "This chase is very similar to chase of SL against India in CT. Early wickets, no one expected the chase will be achieved, but useful contribution throughout and chase done easily"

commentTextItems.html: much fuller outside off, eased to deep cover
fired full on middle and leg, turned to square leg. Half-century for Raza, now for him to see this off. Can he do it?
slider, he makes room to cut. Very late on the shot but somehow manages to get some bat onto it, point comes around

dismissalComment.html: dreadful shot to a loose delivery that should've been whacked for four. Masakadza was way too early into the pull as he gloved this down leg side to the keeper. Oh, hang on. The umpire's are having a look. This could be a no-ball. Looks like there was just about a millimetre behind the crease at the point of impact. Very, very close.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c & b Gunaratne 112 (96b 14x4 0x6 164m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear! Soft dismissal. Gunaratne's chance of pace does it. Back of a length delivery, Mire is hanging back and pushes it back to the bowler, can't keep it down as he does not read the drop in pace too well. Gunaratne takes it without fuss. What a good innings this has been. He has given Zimbabwe a real chance here.Up to Williams and the rest now

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Tharanga b Dananjaya 18 (23b 2x4 0x6 37m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: this was just a matter of time. Both batsmen were completely in a tangle against spin. Ervine looks to sweep this and gets across a long way to play the shot, had to hit it against the stiff breeze. Didn't get any power behind the shot as it lobbed straight to the man stationed at deep backward square leg.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Gunaratne 65 (69b 7x4 0x6 116m) SR: 94.2

dismissalComment.html: oh, dear. Williams, what have you done? Plays all around a full delivery. Looked to nurdle this to the leg side but was better off looking to ease it down the ground. This was full, cramped him for room and deflected off the boot onto the stumps. Back to back wickets for Asela. Sri Lanka are up and running

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza not out 67 (56b 7x4 1x6 57m) SR: 119.64
Malcolm Waller not out 40 (29b 4x4 0x6 48m) SR: 137.93

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (638) involving teams Sri Lanka & Zimbabwe in ODIs

stories.title: Dickwella fined for attempted Mire stumping
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle
stories.seoTitle: Niroshan Dickwella fined for attempted Solomon Mire stumping
stories.summary: Niroshan Dickwella has been fined 30% of his match fee, and handed two demerit points, for a stumping attempt that was deemed to be "contrary to the spirit of the game" by match officials

image.caption: Solomon Mire's fourth half-century kept Zimbabwe alive in a stiff chase
image.longCaption: Solomon Mire's fourth half-century kept Zimbabwe alive in a stiff chase, Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle, June 30, 2017

stories.title: Mathews blames sloppy fielding for another defeat
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle
stories.seoTitle: Angelo Mathews blames sloppy fielding for another defeat
stories.summary: Three catches were dropped during the innings - two of them off top-scorer Solomon Mire - as Sri Lanka failed to defend a target of 317

image.caption: Solomon Mire was put down by Lasith Malinga on 94
image.longCaption: Solomon Mire was put down by Lasith Malinga on 94, Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle, June 30, 2017

stories.title: Zimbabwe ace first successful 300-plus chase in Sri Lanka
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe ace first successful 300-plus chase in Sri Lanka
stories.summary: Solomon Mire, who was the architect of the win, also racked up the fourth fastest ODI century for Zimbabwe

image.caption: Zimbabwe break the barrier
image.longCaption: Zimbabwe create history by chasing 300 successfully in Sri Lanka.

stories.title: Mire's maiden ton scripts record chase
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle
stories.seoTitle: Solomon Mire's maiden ton scripts record chase
stories.summary: Solomon Mire's belligerent 112 and half-centuries from Sean Williams and Sikandar Raza helped Zimbabwe run down Sri Lanka's 316 and register the highest successful chase by any team in the country
stories.byline: The Report by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Solomon Mire celebrates his maiden ODI century
image.longCaption: Solomon Mire celebrates his maiden ODI century, Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle, June 30, 2017

stories.title: Depleted Sri Lanka offer Zimbabwe a glimmer
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Galle
stories.seoTitle: Depleted Sri Lanka offer Zimbabwe a glimmer
stories.summary: While the result of a Sri Lanka-Zimbabwe match would be predictable in normal circumstances, the first ODI may give Zimbabwe a chance to break their drought in Sri Lanka

image.caption: Kusal Mendis uses his wrists to pick up a boundary on the leg side
image.longCaption: Kusal Mendis uses his wrists to pick up a boundary on the leg side, Sri Lanka v Pakistan, Champions Trophy 2017, Group B, Cardiff, London, June 12, 2017
